Tired of reading about successful #gamedev people getting "writer's block." That's a luxury of the rich. Do your job, punks.

@gamesyouloved @Lord_Arse Capcom clearly at work here. lol Viper! Whoo! ;)
@OriginalPSP Yep. It's a business. If it makes money, it will be done. I'm not saying every gamer must submit to $$. CEOs, however, <3 it.
@vulcanjedi @MacNN_Mike @paigebelmont Fighting over hardware is old news, sure; but hating someone over their game choice is...newer, IMO.

@lostwolfe I try to keep mine 5 minutes or shorter so that people can have heart attacks. :)
@lostwolfe Haha! I have done similar, friend, though my videos tend to be shorter. :P
It's easy to be a #gaming snob; but if people are having fun, most likely it's best to chill. Fun is good.
@paigebelmont @MacNN_Mike I used to badmouth lots of new games, but I've calmed down a bit. lol If people are happy, kk.
@paigebelmont @MacNN_Mike There was a time when gamer meant outsider, challenge-seeker, etc. Oldies can't let that go. I had to deal myself.
@vulcanjedi @paigebelmont @MacNN_Mike For example, the creator of the Game Boy was confused by new developments. He said, "Are these games?"
@vulcanjedi @paigebelmont @MacNN_Mike Well, I think she's probably referring more to people objecting not to poor quality, but new content.
My pal ended up buying #StreetFighter 2010 because of me. lol He's going to show me how it's done, he says. Uh huh. #retrogaming #WAR
@paigebelmont I think it came about with the diversification of gaming. People had a clear idea of what "game" meant, then it all changed.
@MacNN_Mike @paigebelmont No, it's been a more recent development.
Dabbling in lighting has been interesting/frustrating. lol I did enough to have fun. Now no more until Game 2. :P #gamedev
